wikipedia_page.main: James Daws (27 May 1898 – June 1985) was an English professional footballer who played as a right half. He played 75 games in the Football League for Birmingham and Bristol Rovers.

response: Dale played for Stanley United, North Walbottle and West Hartlepool before joining Football League First Division club Birmingham on trial in March 1922. The trial proved successful, he made his Football League debut on 6 September 1922 in a goalless draw away to Newcastle United, and, according to the Athletic News in March 1924, he "gave such a sound and, indeed, striking display, even at left half-back, that he has been considered a regular member of the side ever since." He kept his place for two more matches before the England international Percy Barton returned from injury. A few weeks later, after more injuries left a vacancy at right half, Dale "demonstrated his versatility by at once falling into the position", and held it until mid-March 1923 when Jimmy Daws came back into the team. He made 34 League appearances in the 1923–24 season, mainly at right half but also covering at centre half.
